caption: So me an my lady had the Bee Sting and the Famous. The flavor of the toppings are pretty much the same. But the crust is different. They changed the crust. Unless the cook their pizzas for delivery different... Anyway it was cool but its not what I remember
Not the best pizza I've had or the best prices, but the vibe and employees were quite nice. Had the classico and the white, but didn't enjoy it as much as my friends did.

I used to really love Robertas. Excellent pizza. But I recently ordered from Uber Eats and the pizza came burnt, cold (expected), and shriveled up. The bee sting still had good flavors but the margherita was nowhere close to good. Since it was a delivery, I didn’t really have any recourse.
Just amazing pizza, incredible!
The bee sting is one of my favorite pizza in the city, hands down.
Best pizza ever!!
Worth the wait along with the 30 other delivery drivers

I used to be a Roberta’s ambassador recommending it to my family and friends and their friends. Unfortunately, after 10 years of loving Roberta’s and their pizza and atmosphere, I can solemnly  say I will never return again. Today’s experience was the nail in the coffin. The pizza used to be made with love, the staff always had an attitude but not straight up rude. I think shifting their business model to mass production led them down the road of so many other once great brands. Like, you were one of the best in NYC, the world one might even say, wasn’t that enough? Man, I’m just really sad writing this. I have two stars because of the happy memories of what was once a place I truly loved and advocated for. You will be dearly missed.

Oh my God, Roberta's was certainly terrific. Very friendly, excellent menu items & mood. Every single menu item that we have ordered was super fresh and flavorful. The crew was excellent, literally every one. Can not wait to come back to Roberta's. Certainly recommending to others.

I’d been here before in the past and it had been excellent, but I unfortunately had a bad experience yesterday here with friends. When my friend ordered, she didn’t have a great experience with the staff, and I also saw them being overtly rude to another man that had forgotten to wear his mask, which should have warranted a curt warning instead of a scene and ironically, one of the staff members took down their mask to call someone’s name later anyway. After ordering our $77 worth of pizza, we went to the seating area and the server stretched the truth a bit on the availability and we had to sit in the cold, dark back corner, which was not a comfortable experience. The server’s solution to this situation for us was to purchase their beer, which we already weren’t enthusiastic about because we just wanted to comfortably eat our pizza. We all felt mislead into the situation, and since we had already ordered, we had to freeze outside until we got a spot closer to the heat. Next to our chairs in the seating area, we found some beers that the previous party forgot and started to drink them, because why not. It seemed like a silver lining to the situation. After a while, one of the staff members came over and let us know that we brought outside drinks into the bar and that that wasn’t allowed. We explained that we found the beers within the bar and had no idea that they weren’t from the bar, and in return, they kicked us out of the seating area, which stuck me as extremely rude considering that we patronized them with $77 worth of pizza otherwise and it made an already uncomfortable experience that much worse.  What I disliked the most is that the staff was dishonest about their capacity, and instead of being honest about that and turning us away, they instead wanted to take our money and give us an inferior experience in return. It really seemed like they thought we didn’t deserve their seating even though we purchased $77 worth of pizza. There’s really no excuse to be that disrespectful to customers, and I will not be recommending Roberta’s to friends or going back myself out of principle.
Had the famous original. Was amazing. Best pizza of our self-guided 5 stop pizza tour.
Nice chewy crust, great ingredients. Got the Bee Sting, very tasty. However the pie was smaller than I thought for the price and the slices were cut quite askew.
Came in just to order pizza bread. And it was heavenly. Why just pizza bread? Because we just had ichiran a few blocks away and the pizza dough is to die for
It’s that good good! Every time I eat it I just want dance
Definitely a must-go if you are in the area! The pizza is delicious and baked to perfection! They also have a great selection of drinks and good seating.

This spot is usually my go-to splurge meal. I've let many of my friends know about Roberta's because I love it so much. The pizza is pretty small to begin with, but good quality. However with my bad experience I prob won't go back. The pizza I got was SO small. Definitely not 12 inches; more like 9.5". I was upset because I ordered it for my boyfriends birthday, and it's a pricey pizza to begin with. I ate it and was still hungry; I even called and the lady on the phone wasn't accommodating or seemed to care at all. Pretty upsetting tbh
Love the food here! One of the best pizza 🍕 spots in Brooklyn. Highly recommend. If you want authentic Napolitano Margherita style pizza, come here! All their other entrées are delicious too.
Love love the food here. The Bee Sting is highly recommended! Probably the best pizza I’ve had in the city. The wait was excruciatingly long so definitely order ahead of time.

Horrible pizza place!! Go somewhere else!! The staff were super rude!! They said they didn’t have heat lamps when I saw plenty of them being used to other customers! I was there with 5 other people. The waitress kept rolling her eyes at me and saying the pizza will be done soon!! The waitress didn’t even apologize when it took too long! I was at this place for 2 hours!! I was so upset I didn’t leave a tip!! I will not go back to this place again!!
Overpriced for a OK pizza. Overloud music, impossible to talk withouth yelling. Overall...overrated

I would give it a good 7.75. Patsy's in East Harlem is still my only 10 with the old Grimaldi's (now julians) close runner up   This pizza was good for sure however for $24, it was likely the smallest 1 serving pizza I have ever had.  I would definitely go back.  Service super friendly.  Call ahead and its waiting for your pick up.

I wish I could rate the food here, but I ordered from here twice, and both times the food never came. First time the driver showed up with just a salad after waiting over two hours. Second time we waited 3 hours, and then they decided they were overwhelmed and wouldn’t be processing the order. Customer service means you work until the orders you’ve promised are fulfilled. Not cancel all orders when the clock strikes close. If you work there, make it up me 🍕🍕🍕
Great food

Waited 30 minutes in the frigid cold only for them to tell me they had given my order to someone else. Had to wait another 20 minutes for them to remake it. No apology given. Poor customer service.  EDIT: Not only that, they forgot all of the meat for my Lil Stinker!!
(Translated by Google) Pizza is great.  (Original) Pizza ist top.

Ordered delivery from Roberta’s last week.  Doordash delivered promptly and the pizza was still hot and fresh! I ordered the Bee Sting & Famous Original pies. Honestly, the only reason why it’s 4 stars is because the pies are tiny, basically a personal pizza for $21 lol. My phone makes the pizza look bigger than it rly was. I wish we got more pizza for the price but alas I understand that the ingredients and thought behind each pie might be the reason why it costs so much. It tastes great.
Great place awesome pizza
It deserves the hype.
Love it
(Translated by Google) THE BEST PIZZA OF MY LIFE 🤤  (Original) LA MEJOR PIZZA DE MI VIDA 🤤
I am so sorry for this oops- this is me
Great large outdoor space in Bushwick with yummy pizza. Get the Bee Sting.

I love Roberta's pizza which is why I'm disappointed to write a negative review regarding their customer service. I came in today to place an order to-go Sunday 12/27 at noon, and the woman working there was so incredibly rude. She rolled her eyes at me and aggressively pointed to the register instead of answering my questions and using words. When I picked up the pizza at the door she grilled me on what the name's of the pizzas were, then said "yeah whatever" and pushed them into me. Her attitude was shocking to me, coming from such a respected restaurant. Unfortunately this has left a bad taste in my mouth and I don't plan to return, I'd rather take my business somewhere they respect customers.
Best brick-oven pizza in the area!
Good pizza, way better than the chains, a little pricey
Wonderful place, ambience, pizzas
Great pies but don't order online; they don't fulfill the order properly and don't refund for what they forgot.
Pizza was certainly excellent here however the Cacio e Pepe was so on point, it enticed me make the better decision to order both Pizza & Pasta here during future trips

This place is amazing. Go here all the time get the ice cream, bread butter. Stractellia, sticky buns and famous original with speck and sooperseta!! Amazing also clam pasta if you Go to restaurant . Just start dancing have had woman flash Me before in excitement just from eating there. Absolutely amazing

It is good the restaurant closed when employees tested positive for Covid. Another problem here - too many people wait outside for pick up clustered together not 6 feet apart, not following covid guidelines.
Love this spot. Got to get Cheeseburger, the clam pasta or famous original!! Also sticky buns are crack
Favorite pizza place in Brooklyn. Naw, favorite pizza place period. We got shirts after we ate there. Like, we aren't the type of people to get restaurant merch at all and we totally got shirts.

Placed an order via chow now and never received a pick up window via email even after 30 minutes had passed. Phoned them and waited on hold for over 20 min. Ended up hanging up. If you can't take orders from other platforms TURN OFF ordering for those platforms. Will stick to other local options like Ops. Awful.

Love Roberta’s and miss grabbing pizzas and sitting out in the patio. I also love taking friends from out of town and watching their skeptical faces go from confusion to pure elation after a fabulous meal here.
I love their croissant with tasty jam, and marinated cucumbers
OMGG i can’t believe! I love everything! 🤩
Sick courtyard one of the nicest places to go during the pandemic
Great pizza...the bouncer, Crazy Legs, was very nice!
Cookies are amazing

I ordered pickup and their pickup line is extremely quick. You walk up, give your name, an employee brings you the food and you’re off! The best part is that it’s completely separate from the sit-down restaurant portion so there’s none of the chaos of trying to flag a waiter or bartender down. The pizza is incredible too! I wouldn’t recommend the bread, it’s quite a sour sourdough loaf.

Hipster hype. This pizza is over priced for what you receive. People please think for your self when offering an opinion and don’t just recommend somewhere that’s “cool.” I want good food at a good price and if this is what you’re looking for too, keep looking.

The staff were rude. Were told we had to leave our table 20minutes before we supposedly had to, completely unapologetically too - I had literally only just been given my pizza. Weren't told we'd have a time limit before we sat down so it came as a shock to us. The food was great as always.

Usually when I visit in the summer it's a cool vibe and very easy going.  Went there last night with my wife and 5 year old and had an unpleasant time.  They have large tents in the outdoor garden area that seem to collect water.  We were seated near the end of a tent and wind kept pushing the water out and splashing us.  The waitress was helpful and offered us towels.  Some other workers came and offered to help, ultimately telling us to move the table over.  Then the manager came over and scolded us about covid distancing and said we have to move the table back.  We get it, we understand, however this was not our fault and there really wasn't any compensation for their tent's malfunction. We paid our full bill of $125 and left.
Always iconic
Really really great pizza, drinks and service. I will be returning soon.
Great Food And Service
The Bee Sting alone is five stars for me. I’ve tried a lot of their other pies but none of them are in the same tier imo. Honorable mentions: the stracciatella & their cheeseburger
A little on the pricey side, but definitely delicious and worth the splurge! Margs are strong and pizza is amazing! My favorite is the bee sting! Dog friendly and super cool environment!
(Translated by Google) Great pizza and very affordable prices  (Original) Magnífica pizza y precios muy accesibles
waited 15 minutes in the rain pizza was just ok. staff seemed  cool and helpful. fyi you can only purchase pie for take out and it wasn't filling pricey as well.
Gotta get the bee sting !! 🐝
No more Calzones...wack!!! I should give them 3 stars but the have 3 Floyds now so....
Food and service were great. Wait times, not so great. Outdoor seating could use some work. If you're not under the tents then you're out in the dark and cold. Pizza was top notch.
Pizza was amazing just a little over priced
An amazing pizza experience
Great pizza and service.

It's a trek for me to get here, but even during a pandemic, it's so worth it. My go-to is the Bee Sting (never gets old), and the Beastmaster is another solid favorite, but if we're being honest, I've never had a pizza here I didn't like. I'm already thinking of my next visit as I write this...

This is not a place to eat pizza - this is a place where pizza "happens". I am traveling to Italy approx. annually and I really know what pizza is about, u can call me a pizza expert. Top notch Pizza means: best quality ingredients, a crunchy thin dough and the 100% right oven time  and temperature - thats what u get at Roberta's. Plus an unique atmosphere, top service, best cocktails!
The bees pizza is the choice to go.  Trust me on this
Best pizza in Brooklyn by far
Best pizza in Bushwick and one of the best in Brooklyn and even New York. Patio space is awesome, great spot to relax and enjoy a nice day out
My first time here, had the Firestarter pizza, it was underwhelming.  But I do think they are known for other pizzas, I will definitely go back and try their signature and Margherita.

Don’t be ridiculous - why are you even debating this. Just go, excellent pizza and good cocktails. Get the Bee Sting pie, maybe even two. Consider the Speckenwolf, Beastmaster, Cheesus Christ also. Beautiful outdoor space
Pizza is so delicious. The atmosphere is cool and vibrant.
The pizza was delicious; beautiful place even during COVID times

Dope pizzas, racial profiling from the hostess.. I ordered a couple of pizzas using ChowNow for collection (I chose this platform as it connects you directly to the restaurant and they don't take a cut like many of the others), and on arrival I asked the hostess where I should go for collections. She immediately sent me down the road to the collection area.. I thought nothing of it. At the collection area, after waiting in line for my turn I was told that for direct orders I was to go inside the main restaurant (a different area), and that this area was only for delivery pickups - Grubhub / Seamless etc... It didn't take me long to realise that she made the assumption that I was there for a delivery pickup because I'm an Indian guy with brown skin. That wouldn't have happened if I was white, because most delivery guys look like me. I don't think there was malice there, but it was down to her unconscious bias.. and to be frank, as anyone that has experienced that kind of profiling on any level would understand, it upset me. I should have called her out on it at the time, but to be honest I was too upset and actually quite hungry. Robertas: like I said, your pizzas are dope, but not all brown men that come and collect pizzas are delivery guys.  Update: I tried to contact Roberta's about this via all of their email addresses given on their website, however they all bounced back - literally none of them work. Customer service at it's finest!
It's Roberta's, of course 5 stars.
The pizza's were a bit pricey but very delicious.  We had takeout due to the long wait times for a table.  Make reservations in advance for a table.
By far the best pizza I had 🍕🍕
I love their pizza. Their outdoor space is awesome and very spacious - great especially on a nice day. Great place to come and chill that serves one of the best pizzas in the city.
Insane! Bee sting and the Famous original are definitely to die for! From crust to cheese, these people know how to make you come back for more!

The Bee Sting pie was a perfect blend of savory, sweet, and spicy flavors placed in a fine crust. Try to get here when they open to get a seat in their garden or book a reservation. The place had a good vibe and the soundtrack playing was a nice mix of the 80s and the present day.
AMAZING!!!
Nice backyard and pizza!
Wonderful outdoor dining area. It was incredible to have real cocktails and well executed food again. You can make reservations for a table to enjoy the space before the cold weather sets in.
Best pizZa in town! Check out the outdoor patio and get the stracciatella to start!
Chill place with good food
An institution. Go.

Lunchtime during COVID-19 is pretty easy and the food is the same great stuff! Gone are the crowded communal tables where you were piled up on top of people, plenty of hand sanitizer stations, cash free, so you have to take a card to pay.
OK, let's go. I usually get the basic pizza, but, splurged on the pop choice of Bee Sting. Love. Get it with a chilled red. Yep.
love this place best pizza
One of the best pizza in brooklyn nyc
Ver rude staff
Amazing pizza

I don’t need to be interrogated to pick up an order for my gf, i was asked if I had a pizza bag.. because they thought I was the delivery person, I even brought her phone to show since it was listed in the pick up notes. Then to be questioned about what was ordered. I don’t care how good this place is, I’ll get my pizza elsewhere.

Amazing pizza. Great outdoor seating in a courtyard like setting. Pizza isn’t exactly crispy but somehow still delicious. The bee sting was far and away my favorite. So delicious. Staff was nice. Good amount of beers anywhere from 5-7 dollars. Not exactly cheap but the experience and food is worth it. Check this one out. Call ahead for a reservation because it was packed
Delicious pizza and drinks. Good service.

Roberta's has the best pizza in New York.  Our favorites are the garlic knots, pizza rolls, the bee sting and famous original.  The Bushwick setup even during COVID is a pleasure, the staff are supper pleasant & really accommodating. Plan ahead, reserve and check the weather.  And don't forget to buy a tee or their book when you leave.
Food is good but def over rated. There are reservations available and quick seating out front which smells horrible.  I guess I'm not a fan of the bushwick ambiance.
Delicious pizza

We were in Brooklyn for the day & came here on a recommendation. It was during the Pandemic & their arrangements made us pretty comfortable.  The hostess was extremely courteous & made sure we got the exact meal we wanted considering we weren't that hungry.  We ordered the Spratzatella, sardough bread with cheese, and it was great. The bread was soft and the cheese went perfectly on it without making any mess.  For the meal we shared their Famous Original pizza with mushrooms & it was the perfect brick oven pizza we were looking for.  Highly recommend!
Roberta’s is simply fantastic. By far the best pizza in town in a cozy atmosphere.

Found street parking right outside. Excellent thin crust pizza, margarita was our favorite, also had white guy, the ripper and classic original, all delicious! outdoor seating was well spaced and shaded, staff was masked, friendly and attentive, liquor bar and variety of beers all six of us found a favorite.  Check came back with a 50% tip added.  They fixed it right away.
Great pizza.. tried several of them but my favorite was the bee sting. Has both sweet and savory flavor profiles. Nice charred crust.
Really bad service. Food not that good.
Good pizza bad service
Placed my scheduled delivery order over six hours in advance.  They cancelled at the last minute without explanation. Very frustrating — a heads up would’ve been appreciated!
Great pizza 🍕 the pasta 🍝 even better!
Best 🍕
The Gatekeepers of Pizza Culture.
Good food

Only been to Roberta's a few times and have never been disappointed. They make amazing pizza! I had the Bee Sting with the hot salami and honey. I enjoyed it very much, sweet and spicy. The staff were super friendly and accommodating (we asked them to split our shared appetizers into separate dishes, no problem,  they didn't even think twice about it, A+) The tables are spread apart enough to feel safe. There is hand sanitizer everywhere, the staff all wear masks.  Recommend highly!
Snarly waiter but the rest of the staff was amazing and the food is always great. I will not go back until the inside reopens to not have to deal with this waiter
Great thin crust Italian style pizza with both traditional and unusual toppings, generally busy and always a wait, but it's worth it for both the pizza and the atmosphere

Great food you have to try the cobbler like omg the cobbler. Our server, Willy, was the absolute man. He was perfect and super knowledgeable about all the menu items as well as the wine list. 10/10 would eat here again!

The pizza never disappoints here! The corn is also really good and I’m looking forward to trying the other non-pizza dishes. The service is great, but there is usually a bit of a wait on the food. Their outdoor seating area is super cute and they play upbeat music - all around fun spot!
Roberta's is fantastic! I love, love, love the bee sting pizza, and am so glad they're my local pizza joint. Also, don't sleep on the carrot cake whoopie pie, they're absurdly delicious!
The food and the drink were amazing! Best pizza I've ever tried.

I’m very disappointed with this place, totally different from my expectations starting with the blonde host with an attitude problem, she is not a professional person not an welcoming place. I don’t recommend this place. 08/02/20
A trip to Brooklyn is incomplete without a stop at Roberta's pizza. One of the best pizza to titillate my taste buds. Had just about everything on the menu personal favorite is the Bee Sting.
They gave me a fully burnt white guy pizza through Postmates. Waste of money.
Great outdoor space, spread out, delicious food
The beesting is legit and the outdoor patio is perfect

We had a reservation for outside but called ahead to verify rain wouldn’t be an issue. Staff told us they had a tent so it was all good!  Upon arriving after a 45min trek to get there we saw that they had texted us saying all outdoor reservations were cancelled. Even if we had seen the text as it came in we would have still been well on our way. They wouldn’t even allow us to order “to go” pizza and sit in their outdoor seating even though there was plenty of space. Probably won’t be making plans to come back considering there are so many other options.
Currently seating people outdoors, but I chose to pickup. They had a great system for staying clean while you decide what you wanted from the menu, and pizza came out fast! It was delicious as always

Love this place. Food is so elegant. Highly recommend you explore outside the pizza. Salads are next level and the homemade pasta is a revelation.  Servers are great, 4 stars only because for the price point, I think the food comes at you a little fast. If I am going to drop a hundred bucks on an occasion dinner for two, I want some time between courses, not overlapping. 100% not the fault of the very excellent servers tho— think it may just be restaurant’s policy as it is so busy.
Must eat here at least once in your lifetime!

Freaking love this spot. Especially during these times of quarantine- they’ve opened their garden dining area up.  You can make reservations on the Resy application. They don’t do reservations otherwise.  Great alcohol selection, music, and most importantly- amazing pizza.  Good amount of apps too! The calamari and romaine salad was great.  Pictured below is the Bee Sting and Margarita.

On a long and lonesome highway East of Omaha You can listen to the engine Moanin' out his one note song…  Written in 1973, Bob Seger's, Turn the Page was written about Maggie. Maggie (at the time) was part human and part semi-truck. She was not quite a transformer due to her biological nature, but she had all the qualities of a transformer including her electromagnetic and induction laws. Maggie toured with Mr. Seger until his retirement. You can find Maggie, now in total human form, either on the dance floor or in Chicago.
Incredible pizza and wonderful outdoor space. Had never tried a pizza with honey on it before, but now I am hooked.

Wow... what a serious disappointment... :( don’t believe all the hype. This place is sadly overrated. Went several times too... Waited over 30 minutes for my one pizza to be made on a Tuesday at 6pm... (and it wasn’t like it was that busy either), a week ago I went I was turned away that they couldn’t / wouldn’t take my order at 9:55pm because even though I had 5 minutes left even after walking blocks to get here....  For $18.50 you get a small Margherita (if it even qualifies to be called that, read on) personal pizza with an extremely thin paper like floppy crust, almost NO sauce (which maybe that’s a good thing because the sauce is flavorless) and a small amount of buffalo mozzarella cheese... Did I mentioned that it was mostly burnt? It was, badly. 3 times I’ve been here in June - July, 3 times a bad experience, kept thinking it would be better next time... WRONG. Maybe they were once great back in the day and got too popular and changed like all good things that take a turn for the worst... The service is GOD-AWFUL too despite what some others (employees??) reviews say...  Come on guys get it together you can’t charge this much for this bad an experience, can’t live off the name alone.... Literally not worth the time/effort with so many good pizza spots in Brooklyn...
Delicious

Out of this world delicious pizza!  Super friendly staff and prompt service. The Bee Sting pizza and Marinated cucumber salad is a must for these hot summer days. Run, don't walk to this place!😉🍕🧄🧅🍹🍸🍽
Unique
Millennial Falco is beautiful
Great atmosphere, feels like you're not in bk once you get there. Nice variety of brock oven pizzas
Fresh food
The food was a good, but omg the portions very small and expensive
Best pizza in bushwick! Great outdoor seating and drink selection
The manager is an absolute saint and our pizza was incredible. This the BEE STING.
Good pizza but they don't were mask and gloves
Great 🍕 , the dough is fantastic

(Translated by Google) They are rich pizzas but not from another world. Waiters very good until your tip doesn't seem enough  (Original) Son pizzas ricas pero no del otro mundo. Los camareros muy bien hasta que tu propina no les parece suficiente
How my pizza come with no cheese.
Best pizza!!
(Translated by Google) Very authentic and very good pizzas  (Original) Muy auténtico y muy buenas pizzas

My all time favorite pizza spot in Brooklyn! From the vibes to their delicious pizza! They change their pizza menu often so you get to try all their amazing choices. They have a nice open patio that they open during the warm season which is a great hangout spot for friends and family!
🍕 Pizza is the best in Brooklyn 👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾 Support your Local Restaurants!!!
I would eat every meal here if I could
Best pizza!
Great pizza! The Cowabunga Dude was my favorite.

Sat at the bar and had the Cowabunga Dude. It was delicious and an upscale take on the pies my parents would order when we were kids. I polished the pizza off myself! Generous with the toppings too. The rest of the menu looked great so I can't wait to try other dishes besides their pizza next time. Good vibes at the bar and a casual atmosphere. Will be returning for more!
I had pizza the one with honey and I love it. Don’t remember the name but the waitress said it is one of the favorites.
My family are regulars best pizza in nyc i go so much that when u google robertas im standing outside the pizzeria waiting for my takeout the baldheaded guy with orange pumas
Delicious pizza 😋
Delicious pizza, excellent wine offer, very relaxed environment, the service is perfect. It can be busy sometimes.
Good placa original and informal, wonderfull pizzanin a City in which this is something almost impossible to find

Been here once before and wasn’t caught up in the hype that time, but eating inside on a cold day was different this time, awesome pizza and friendly service, definitely worth checking out if in the area!!
Pizza was good, would have been better if they served them warm. You shouldn't be in a rush if you are waiting for your Pizza. Long waiting time. Pizza rolls were poor. Paid 5$ for 3 small rolls.
Horrible service. Not worth the price they're asking. Better options at their price point and below.
Great vibe, great pizza and good variety. In summer especially this is a great place to hang out for a few drinks and a pizza. Only thing to improve would be friendliness of staff.

Making a list of places in NYC to get pizza. Put this one pretty close to the top. In fact, take the train over for this alone if you need to. Great pizza and great service. We didn’t have to wait, but we waited on the dinner menu print just to make sure we had all the options, but I imagine there isn’t a single thing on the menu that isn’t good.
Food, staff were excellent. Location different
Rude staff.
I loved it before, but the breakfast and onion pizza were surprisingly not great.
Great pizza and comfortable space.
I went to  Roberta's Pizza &Bakery last Saturday and I must say it was delicious.  I am not a big pizza eater but Roberta's has gain a  new customer .
Ask for the "Chesus-Christ" 👌
Very good wood burning flavor fresh Mozzarella good sauce.
Wood oven pizza ,Gourmet toppings,sooooo good
Love this place, best pizza in the city hands down
The Bee Sting isn’t on the menu but it’s a must! The sourdough bread is also amazing
Great atmosphere, great music but overall try Theo cheesus chirst pizza!!! Bomb!!!!

(Translated by Google) Nice place, atypical but far from Manhattan Good pizza but nothing more. Radins on the garnish. You eat an "improved" margarita Pizza "BeastMaster" (master of the beasts) with only 3 poor pieces of pork fighting in a duel ... Not worth the trip, especially at $ 17 a margarita Nice place, unique but far away from Manhattan Good pizzas but not more. You just eat an upgraded margarita with poor garnish When they call a pizza "BeastMaster" but give you a margarita with 2/3 debris of porc and some onions ... Lol ... Don't waste your time and go Italy  (Original) Lieu sympa, atypique mais loin de Manhattan Pizza bonnes mais sans plus. Radins sur la garniture. Vous mangez une margarita "améliorée" Pizza "BeastMaster" (maître des bêtes) avec seulement 3 pauvres bouts de porc qui se battent en duel... Ne vaut pas le déplacement, surtout à 17 dollars la margarita Nice place, unique but far away from Manhattan Good pizzas but not more. You just eat an upgraded margarita with poor garnish When they call a pizza " BeastMaster" but give you a margarita with 2/3 debris of porc and some onions... Lol... Don't waste your time and go Italy

Food was good although a bit pricey , and also a long wait to get your Pizza . There is like some kind of beer garden or something next door but I wasn't sure exactly so I didn't go in. It would be better if the staff told us about the beer garden next door . Also there's no where to wait for your pizza kinda stuck in a small corner. It would be cool to have them just send a text when the pizza is done . So overall Good pizza , confusing experience , long wait = 4/5 stars

The pizza wasn't anything spectacular.  I should have known when I said to one of the chefs, "this is where the magic happens," and he responded by saying, "what magic?"  There are many pizzeria's in nyc today, but very few that live up to the authentic standard of a cheesy ny style slice.  20 years ago, one slice was a meal.  Today, we have places like Roberta's pizza.  My suggestion, if you want mediocre pizza, save your money and go to one of the cheap shops in lower manhattan.
good NYC pizza!
Great price for hand crafted classic and modern Italian foods. Pizza is top notch.
Authentic
Food was delicious,  the cucumber salad yummy!

One of the top pizza spots! Thin crust, great sauce and interesting toppings if you want them. Like the vibe but on weekends be prepared to wait (or order take out and have it at the tiki bar next door).
. Pizza was really good but definitively not worth waiting one hour and thirty minutes
Amazing pizza!

There’s no question why this place one of the top pizza destinations in New York. The pizzas are amazing. It’s crust guy and Roberta’s is among my favorites. In the mood for something sweet and savory? Order the Bee Sting pizza. You won’t regret it.

I can't believe it took me so long to visit Roberta's. It's not only takeout, as google suggests. There is indoor and outdoor seating which is very suitable for both large and small groups. Pizza is wood fired an amazing. We tried most of the pizzas on the menu and of all of them I recommend the Lieutenant Dan. Start with a romaine salad and a combo plate while you're waiting.
Great Pizzas. Nice staff.

The place is really aesthetically pleasing and the pizza feels extremely authentic with their giant pizza oven. The crust is the right amount of crunch and chewy dough so it’s not paper thin but has the crisp texture. We were seated pretty easily. Food didn’t take long for a wait and the drinks were very good as well. Would definitely go back. (Sorry for my picture quality. It was a late Saturday night)

Perhaps this place was a bit overhyped by what we read and by our BK friends. Had the beastmaster, bee sting, and the original. As out of towners who "don't know pizza until you've had NY pizza," we weren't going to order a third, but after a truly spicy experience with the first two, we opted for something more representative of a traditional pizza experience. We went to another hyped up pizza place the day before, and agreed it was awesome. But Roberta's mythological status for cutting edge artisanal style pizza left us wanting more. The pizza was super thin, sauce was too bitter for our liking, the cheese was barely covering every slice, and the honey was drizzled erratically making some slices sweeter than others in the case of the bee sting. No doubt the chili was fire, and add some hot oil for good measure, your mouth sings, but after two spicy pizzas, the gig was up. I wanted to like it more than we did, but we felt let down.
Absolutely delicious pizza (the kale one) and cos salad was off the chain. Thank you I will be returning for sureeee.
Told myself beforehand I'd eat half & take home the leftovers. 😬 What leftovers?
Pizza is soooo good. I visited there around 6pm and staff prepared table and meal soon.
Great food good service
Taste good but almost no toppings
Okay pizza, bad customer service, employees with attitude!!
It's a little expensive but it's good for Pizza
Looong wait but you can take away. Pizza was pretty good.

An icon of Brooklyn, their pizza is just different. Single person pizzas that are soft and pillowy. Get one pizza per person in your party and share. They are all good, and you can customize them any way you’d like. The romaine salad is also great, and pasta is good but small portions. Truly a place to not miss, especially in summer. This is the takeout place. The sit down version is next door!
Awesome pizza, like that there is separate entrance for order pickup and delivery. The resuraunt part has different entrance.
Mostly a pizza place without seats that serves booze. The speckenwolf was delicious. Also recommend the millennium falco and the margherita is a classic.
(Translated by Google) Delicious pizza!!! Very highly recommended !!!! Simple but delicious pizzas !!!  (Original) Deliciosa pizza!!! Muy muy recomendable!!!! Pizzas sencillas pero riquísimas!!!
If I could I would marry the place

Top of our list. We loved the flavours and the yard attached to it with great music and good drinks. Definitely give this place a try.

Best pizza bar none. I have tried every pizza in the city. I know about these things.

One of our regular pizza. Best woodfire coal pizza.they have a wonderful outdoor place for drinks and dining for all sesasons
They use an open brick oven and fresh ingredients so it made a huge difference in the taste. Loveee the vibe and the food. 10/10!

I like that I can order pizza and pick it up. This area of Robertas makes that happen. The sticky Buns are so addicting, garlic knots are like a play on croissant knots (light and airy) yet still so garlicky goodness.
Disappointed they only had salads a gluten free option. They seem to try very hard to be unaffected and tacky.
Always great Pizza
Lil pricey but excellent taste.
Review from an Italian: The tomato sauce they use is sweet :( Price are high, especially considering the location and facilities; and pizza are medium size
Vegan friendly , Superb taste. Real NYC Pizza
Cool place ! Good pizza !

This is the area called Robert's Pizza & Bakery where you can order to go, plus they do deliveries as well. This is the take out section of Robert's.  Yet they also have a sitting area up front as you enter the other main entrance, plus another sitting area more to the back of that place. You'll see the small bar as you head that way to the back. For Spring, Summer and some Fall weather, they have an outdoor seating area and a Garden area that's on a second floor level.  This business has been here for 10+ years now from what I was told by one of the servers. I came to the sitting part of Robert's for lunch time and they recommended I come for dinner sometime in the future.  I really did enjoy the food, service, staff and atmosphere but my reason for 4 star rating was due to their prices are on the high end. I would recommend them but with caution with those prices. So I tried it but won't be back anytime soon. I know I can get the same ambiance elsewhere for less. That's just my opinion.
